title: Sidewall, "Cherry Forever", 2007
dimensions: H x W x D: 457.2 x 75 cm (15 ft. x 29 1/2 in.)
creditline: Gift of Flavor Paper and Michael Angelo
description: Repeating design of a pair of red cherries, connected by a stem. Printed in shades of red on a green foil ground.  The red pigments contain microencapsulated oils scented with a cherry fragrance. Scratch and sniff version, can also be purchased without the scent.
justification:
Cherry Forever is one of three scented wallpapers in this company's line and is the first commercially produced scratch and sniff wallpaper.&nbsp; Available in three flavors: cherry, banana and tutti fruity this paper is produced using technology first developed by 3M in 1965.&nbsp; Fragrance oils are microencapsulated and printed on the wallpaper surface.&nbsp; The fragrance is released by scratching which breaks the microencapsulated cells.&nbsp; It is possible for the scent to last up to 20 years, but &nbsp;scratching disturbs/abrades the printed surface.&nbsp; Even without the smell it is an attractive paper and the first of its kind.
Novelty papers go back at least as far as the mid-19th century.&nbsp; They were frequently commemorative, humorous, or educational and frequently contained landscape vistas and trompe l'oeil elements.&nbsp; Due to the influence of the British Reform Movement and their belief that all walls must present a 2-dimensional surface these papers were deemed less than appropriate for proper homes.&nbsp; Kitchen, bathroom and children's papers are frequently grouped into this category.&nbsp; Novelty papers reached their peak in the 1950s in the post-war boom and then kind of fizzled out until the last 15 years or so.&nbsp; Novelty papers were usually hung in the less formal rooms of the home.&nbsp; They could be amusing, cocktail/gambling related, personifications of French poodles, or educational in nature.&nbsp; The recent emergence of many small studios printing on a small-scale allows designers/artists to market their wares to niche markets opening a new window for novelty papers.&nbsp; Many of the novelty papers produced today are political or satirical in nature.

tombstone.epitaph: Sidewall, "Cherry Forever", 2007.Screen printed, microencapsulated scented oils. Gift of Flavor Paper and Michael Angelo. 2007-36-1.
